thread.title: Yuan jitters push NZ stocks lower
thread.title_full: Yuan jitters push NZ stocks lower

author: news.com.au
title: Yuan jitters push NZ stocks lower
text:
THE New Zealand sharemarket has closed lower, amid continuing concerns about a slowing Chinese economy.
THE S&P/NZX 50 Index fell 19.52 points, or 0.3 per cent, to 5737.7 on Thursday.
Within the index, 25 stocks fell, 18 rose, and seven were unchanged. Turnover was $118 million. Markets have been rattled after China unexpectedly allowed its currency to weaken this week, stoking concern weaker consumer demand in China - New Zealand's biggest export partner. "The move from China was unexpected and now the question is how often do they do it and how far do they look to devalue," said Robert Garden, investment adviser at Craigs Investment Partners. "With what has been going over in China it's probably unsettling things a wee bit. It leads to risk being taken off the table, and this is all happening against the backdrop of equity valuations that for the most part are still reasonably high although they're coming off a wee bit now." Orion Health Group led the benchmark index lower, down three per cent to $3.85. Other leading stocks to fall included Trade Me down 2.8 per cent to $3.11, Metro Glass 2.7 per cent to $1.42, Air New Zealand 2.4 per cent to $2.635, SkyCity Entertainment Group 1.9 per cent to $4.21 and Spark New Zealand 1.44 per cent to $2.73.
